recommendation: Store and use secrets securely
logic: Check if there are any secrets configured in the workspace by listing scopes and looking for the secrets count against the configured baseline value in those scopes

recommendation: All clusters should enable local disk encryption
logic: Check if enable_local_disk_encryption is set as false for any cluster

check: Customer-managed keys for managed services and workspace storage
recommendation: Add a customer-managed key for managed services and workspace storage
logic: Check if storage_customer_managed_key_id and managed_services_customer_managed_key_id are set for each workspace

check: Object storage encryption for data sources
recommendation: Encrypt object storage data buckets and restrict access
logic: Manual check (Update cofiguration status using <SATProject>/notebooks/Setup/8. update_workspace_configuration notebook)

recommendation: Disable download button for notebook results
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableResultsDownloading setting

recommendation: Configure cluster policies to enforce data access patterns and control costs
logic: Check if policy_id is set for clusters

check: PAT tokens are about to expire
recommendation: Set an expiration day (maximum lifetime) for tokens. Also regularly review PAT tokens to avoid expired tokens.
logic: Check each token expiry_time and report if the expiry_time is within configured days

recommendation: Configure Databricks audit log delivery
logic: Check account log-delivery configuration and look for audit log config with log_type set as "AUDIT_LOGS" and status set as "ENABLED"

recommendation: Restart clusters on a regular schedule to use the latest available base image and container image.
logic: Check each running cluster's last restart time till now and report on clusters that were running longer than the configured number of days without a restart

recommendation: Deprecated runtime version detected. Please update your cluster runtimes to Databricks supported runtimes
logic: List clusters with spark version that is not in the supported spark versions

recommendation: Configure cluster tagging to monitor usage and enable chargebacks
logic: check if custom_tags is set for clusters

recommendation: Configure job tagging to monitor usage and enable chargebacks
logic: Check if settings.new_cluster.custom_tags is not null for job clusters

recommendation: Configure Databricks cluster log delivery
logic: Check if cluster_log_conf is set for clusters

recommendation: Configure Databricks job custer log delivery
logic: Check if cluster_log_conf is set for job clusters

recommendation: The DBFS root is not intended for production customer data
logic: Check the /user/hive/warehouse/ folder for any data folders stored more than the configured value

recommendation: Avoid DBFS mounts for accessing production data
logic: Check for mnt paths in dbutils.fs.mounts() and report if there are datasources loaded as FUSE mounts to the workspace than the configured value

recommendation: Use Unity Catalog enabled clusters
logic: Check if there are clusters without data_security_mode as (USER_ISOLATION or SINGLE_USER) or data_security_mode as none

recommendation: Authenticate via single sign-on and leverage multi-factor authentication
logic: Manual check (Update cofiguration status using <SATProject>/notebooks/Setup/8. update_workspace_configuration notebook)

recommendation: Provision users from your Identity Provider with workspace-level SCIM APIs
logic: Manual check (Update cofiguration status using <SATProject>/notebooks/Setup/8. update_workspace_configuration notebook)

check: Table Access Control for clusters that don't use Unity Catalog
recommendation: For clusters that do not use Unity Catalog, enable Table Access Control in admin settings so that you can utilize Table ACL clusters that enforce user isolation
logic: Manual check (Update cofiguration status using <SATProject>/notebooks/Setup/8. update_workspace_configuration notebook)

check: PAT tokens with no lifetime (expiration) limit
recommendation: Configure maximum token lifetimes for future tokens using token management
logic: Check each token expiry_time and report if the expiry_time is not within the configured number of days or set to never expire by using -1 as the value

recommendation: Configure tagging to monitor usage and enable chargebacks
logic: Check if instance-pools have custom tags configured

check: Set maximum concurrent runs in job configuration
recommendation: Limit the number of parallel runs for a given job to avoid resource contention
logic: Check if max_concurrent_runs configuration for each job is less than configured value

recommendation: Global libraries are discouraged for security reasons. Use cluster libraries or notebook-scoped libraries to improve startup time for clusters that don't require that library, and to improve flexibility where that library is not required.
logic: Check if is_library_for_all_clusters is set as true for any library that is configured for clusters

check: Number of users who have cluster create privileges
recommendation: Limit number of users with cluster create privileges. Note: the threshold for this SAT check can be configured.
logic: Check entitlements.value for each user and look if they have 'allow-cluster-create', 'allow-instance-pool-create' as permission, and count the number of users with such permissions to report if that crossed the configured threshold.

recommendation: Global init scripts are discouraged for security, improved startup and flexibility reasons
logic: Check if there are any global-init-scripts configured

recommendation: Limit the number of admin accounts so that most users are not admins. Note: the threshold for this SAT check can be configured
logic: Check members count of diplayName "admins" in groups to report if the count is more than the configured threshold

check: Detect network peering of VPC (AWS, GCP) or VNet (Azure)
recommendation: Network peering is discouraged because private endpoints are recommended. For example, AWS PrivateLink, Azure Private Link, or Google Private Service Connect.
logic: Manual check (Update cofiguration status using <SATProject>/notebooks/Setup/8. update_workspace_configuration notebook)

check: Job view ACLs are set consistently
recommendation: Use job visibility control to prevent users from viewing jobs where they do not have permissions
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableJobViewAcls setting

check: Cluster view ACLs are set consistently
recommendation: Use cluster visibility control to prevent users from viewing clusters where they do not have permissions
logic: Check workspace-conf for enforceClusterViewAcls setting

check: Workspace View ACLs are set consistently
recommendation: Use workspace visibility control to prevent users from viewing notebooks and other objects where they do not have permissions in the workspac
logic: Check workspace-conf for enforceWorkspaceViewAcls setting

recommendation: It is recommended to store code in Git repos
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableProjectTypeInWorkspace setting

recommendation: Remote SSH access to clusters is discouraged, use web terminal instead
logic: Check if ssh_public_keys is configured on any cluster

recommendation: Remote SSH access to clusters is discouraged, use web terminal instead
logic: Check if ssh_public_keys is configured on any job cluster

recommendation: Configure either private network connectivity or IP access lists for workspace access and REST APIs. You can configure AWS PrivateLink, Azure Private Link, or Google Private Service Connect. Note that enabling and requiring front-end private connectivity are different, see the documentation for details.
logic: Check if private_access_settings_id is set for the workspace

check: Workspace uses a customer-managed VPC (AWS, GCP) or enables VNet injection (Azure)
recommendation: Deploy with a customer-managed VPC (AWS, GCP) or use VNet injection (Azure) to help enforce data exfiltration protections
logic: Check if network_id is set for this workspace

check: IP access lists for workspace access
recommendation: Configure IP access lists or private network connectivity for workspaces to restrict the IP addresses that can authenticate to help protect against data exfiltration and account takeover
logic: Check if ip-access-lists are configured and enabled

check: Maximum lifetime of new tokens to something other than unlimited
recommendation: Configure maximum lifetime for all future tokens to a value other than unlimited
logic: Check workspace-conf for maxTokenLifetimeDays In Workspace setting

check: Secure cluster connectivity (on Azure this is also called NoPublicIp)
recommendation: Configure secure cluster connectivity (On Azure, this is called NoPublicIP / NPIP)
logic: Check if enableNoPublicIp are configured and enabled

recommendation: Enforce user isolation cluster types on a workspace
logic: Check workspace-conf for enforceUserIsolation In Workspace setting

check: Tokens with a lifetime (expiration) that exceeds the workspace maximum lifetime for new tokens
recommendation: Update lifetime for all old tokens
logic: Compare workspace-conf for maxTokenLifetimeDays in workspace setting against all tokens expiration days

recommendation: Run production workloads with service principals
logic: Check if at least one service principle exists for the workspace

check: Enforce AWS Instance Metadata Service v2
recommendation: Enforce AWS Instance Metadata Service v2 on a workspace
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableEnforceImdsV2 In Workspace setting

recommendation: Disable exporting notebooks and cells within notebooks
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableExportNotebook setting

recommendation: Disable the ability of users to copy tabular data to the clipboard via the notebooks UI
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableNotebookTableClipboard setting

recommendation: Enable third-party iFraming prevention
logic: Check workspace-conf for enable-X-Frame-Options In Workspace setting

recommendation: Enable MIME type sniffing prevention
logic: Check workspace-conf for enable-X-Content-Type-Options In Workspace setting

check: Manage XSS attack page rendering prevention
recommendation: Enable XSS attack page rendering prevention
logic: Check workspace-conf for enable-X-XSS-Protection In Workspace setting

check: Enable storing interactive notebook results only in the customer account
recommendation: Enable store interactive notebook results in your account
logic: Check workspace-conf for storeInteractiveNotebookResultsInCustomerAccount setting

check: Enable verbose audit logs (on Azure, diagnostic logs)
recommendation: Enable verbose audit logs (on Azure, diagnostic logs)
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableVerboseAuditLogs setting

check: FileStore endpoint for HTTPS file serving
recommendation: Review and disable FileStore endpoint in admin console workspace settings
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableFileStoreEndpoint setting

check: Store code in Git for notebooks
recommendation: Enable git versioning for notebooks
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableNotebookGitVersioning setting

recommendation: Enable a workspace for Unity Catalog by assigning a Unity Catalog metastore
logic: Check if current-metastore-assignment has the workspace assigned to metastore_id

check: Limit the lifetime (expiration) of metastore Delta Sharing recipient token
recommendation: Set the lifetime of Delta Sharing recipient tokens
logic: Check if delta_sharing_recipient_token_lifetime_in_seconds is set less than 90 days where delta_sharing_scope is INTERNAL_AND_EXTERNAL

recommendation: Configure Delta Sharing IP access lists to restrict recipient access to trusted IP addresses
logic: Check if ip_access_list is present on share recipients for authentication_type "TOKEN"

recommendation: Establish a process for rotating credentials Delta sharing token
logic: Check if expiration_time on share recipients for tokens for share with authentication_type "TOKEN"

recommendation: Create a Unity Catalog metastore
logic: Check if securable_type = 'METASTORE' exists in metasores

check: Delegation of the Unity Catalog metastore admin to a group
recommendation: Delegate metastore admin to a group who is not the account admin
logic: Check if securable_type = 'METASTORE' and owner != created_by for a metastore

check: Direct use of Unity Catalog metastore storage credentials
recommendation: Use external locations rather than using storage credentials directly
logic: Check if securable_type = 'STORAGE_CREDENTIAL' for storage-credentials

recommendation: Enable data warehouses for Unity Catalog
logic: Check if disable_uc = true on warehouses

recommendation: Enable Serverless compute
logic: Check if enable_serverless_compute != true on warehouses

check: Users with Delta Sharing permissions to create a recipient or create a share
recommendation: Limit who has CREATE_RECIPIENT and CREATE_SHARE permissions on metastore. Note: the threshold for this check is configurable.
logic: Check who has  CREATE_RECIPIENT and CREATE_SHARE permission on the metastore

recommendation: Databricks recommends that you migrate legacy scripts to the new global init scripts framework and then disable legacy scripts
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableDeprecatedGlobalInitScripts setting

recommendation: Databricks recommends you avoid storing init scripts in /databricks/init location to avoid unexpected behavior
logic: List DBFS /databricks/init for any files and report

recommendation: Databricks recommends that you migrate legacy cluster-named init scripts to the new cluster-scoped init scripts framework and then disable legacy cluster named init scripts
logic: Check workspace-conf for enableDeprecatedClusterNamedInitScripts setting

recommendation: Manage model lifecycle in Unity Catalog
logic: List the registered models and check if there are any models in UC

recommendation: Secure endpoints of the underlying models served as REST API endpoints using Private connectivity or IP Access Lists
logic: Check if there are any model serving endpoints configured then check if IP Access lists or PL is deployed to prevent the endpoints from being accessed from the public internet

check: Streamline the usage and management of various large language model(LLM) providers
recommendation: Secure third-party models hosted outside of Databricks with Model Serving to streamline the usage and management of various large language model (LLM) providers such as OpenAI and Anthropic within an organization by storing API keys in one secure location
logic: Check if there is not at least one EXTERNAL_MODEL in model serving endpoints configured and alert incase of none

recommendation: Store and retrieve embeddings securely using the Vector Search
logic: List all the Vector Search endpoints and see if at least one endpoint is configured

check: Compliance security profile for new workspaces
recommendation: Validate and deploy on a platform that has put in place controls to meet the unique compliance needs of highly regulated industries
logic: Check if compliance security profile for new workspaces is enabled

recommendation: Add libraries and init scripts to the allowlist in Unity Catalog
logic: Get the artifact allowlist of and check if any allowed artifacts are configured

check: Monitor audit logs with system tables
recommendation: Configure system tables and set up automated monitoring and alerting
logic: Get the the systemschemas for the metastores and see if the access schema is enabled

recommendation: Restrict workspace admins to only change a job owner to themselves and the job run as setting to a service principal that they have the Service Principal User role on
logic: Get the restrict workspace admins setting and check if RestrictWorkspaceAdmins set to ALLOW_ALL

recommendation: Ensure that all the clusters in a workspace are periodically updated to the latest host OS image and security updates
logic: Get the automatic cluster update setting and check the value is set to true

check: Compliance security profile for the workspace
recommendation: Validate and deploy on a platform that has put in place controls to meet the unique compliance needs of highly regulated industries
logic: Check if compliance security profile for new workspaces is enabled

check: Enhanced security monitoring for the workspace

logic: Check if compliance security profile for new workspaces is enabled
